headline.print_headline: Police Break Up Anti-FIFA Protest in Porto Alegre
headline.main: Police Break Up Anti-FIFA Protest in Porto Alegre

lead_paragraph: Police fired stun grenades and tear gas in the southern Brazilian city of Porto Alegre on Wednesday to disperse protesters demonstrating against the World Cup.    The 150 protesters, who marched in the city centre as the World Cup Group B match between Australia and the Netherlands kicked off, were met by a force of several hundred police, Reuters witnesses said.
